block.p: Dr. Jennifer Allison Granite and Dr. David Dominic Matunis, veterinarians in New Jersey, were married last evening by Rabbi Peter Hyman at the Four Seasons Hotel in Philadelphia.

The bride will continue to use her name professionally. She works at the Mount Laurel Animal Hospital, and the bridegroom at the Columbus Central Veterinary Hospital. The couple received undergraduate and veterinary degrees from the University of Pennsylvania. They met in veterinary school.
Dr. Jennifer Allison Granite and Dr. David Dominic Matunis, veterinarians in New Jersey, were married last evening by Rabbi Peter Hyman at the Four Seasons Hotel in Philadelphia.

The bride will continue to use her name professionally. She works at the Mount Laurel Animal Hospital, and the bridegroom at the Columbus Central Veterinary Hospital. The couple received undergraduate and veterinary degrees from the University of Pennsylvania. They met in veterinary school.

The bride, 28, is the daughter of Dr. Betsy Granite and Dr. James Granite of Villanova, Pa. Her father is an endodontist in Ardmore and Springfield, Pa. Her mother is a psychologist for the Lower Merion School District in Ardmore, Pa., and has a private practice in Villanova.
The bridegroom, 29, is a son of Suzanne Matunis and Dr. Joseph Matunis of Loysville, Pa. His father is a family practitioner at the Perry Health Center in Loysville.
